mapper.sql: id, username, age, sex, email, birthday
mapper.insert: insert into t_user (id, username, age, sex, email, birthday) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{birthday,jdbcType=DATE})

insert into t_user
id,
username,
age,
sex,
email,
birthday,
#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER},
#{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{age,jdbcType=INTEGER},
#{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT},
#{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{birthday,jdbcType=DATE},
mapper.update:
update t_user
username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER},
sex = #{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT},
email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
birthday = #{birthday,jdbcType=DATE},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update t_user set username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, sex = #{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT}, email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, birthday = #{birthday,jdbcType=DATE} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select * from t_user order by ${sort.field} ${sort.sord} limit ${(page.page-1)*page.limit},${page.limit}
